dwa_titles: Identify implications for cases from legal precedents or other legal information. | Research relevant legal materials to aid decision making.
task_text: Study Constitution, statutes, decisions, regulations, and ordinances of quasi-judicial bodies to determine ramifications for cases.
justification: This is routine legal research and analysis to determine case ramifications—primarily maintenance/decision-support rather than generating or implementing new business opportunities, advocating new initiatives, taking innovation/risk, or performing managerial entrepreneurial actions (does not match criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Prepare legal documents.
task_text: Prepare, draft, and review legal documents, such as wills, deeds, patent applications, mortgages, leases, and contracts.
justification: This task is routine professional work focused on preparing, drafting, and reviewing standard legal documents—administrative and executional legal services rather than identifying or implementing new business opportunities, championing innovations, planning new ventures, or taking entrepreneurial risks. It does not match opportunity discovery (I), planning/advocacy for new business (II), entrepreneurial implementation/launch activities (III), innovation/risk-taking (IV), managerial actions to create new businesses (V), or eco-innovation (VI).

dwa_titles: Identify implications for cases from legal precedents or other legal information.
task_text: Analyze the probable outcomes of cases, using knowledge of legal precedents.
justification: This task describes routine legal analysis using precedents to predict case outcomes — professional judgment and case preparation rather than generating new business opportunities, championing ideas, implementing innovations, taking entrepreneurial risks, or performing role-specific managerial actions aimed at new ventures (does not meet criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Develop computer or information systems.
task_text: Manage backup, security and user help systems.
justification: This task describes routine operational management and maintenance (backup, security, user help) without signals of opportunity discovery, new product/service planning, advocacy, or risk-taking required by intrapreneurship criteria.

dwa_titles: Maintain knowledge of current developments in area of expertise.
matched_indicators: Scan the environment for opportunities and threats | Maintain knowledge of current developments | Focus on scanning the environment for opportunities and threats (senior-level)
task_text: Stay abreast of advances in technology.
justification: Keeping up with technology advances matches Opportunity Discovery and Idea Generation (I) by scanning the environment for opportunities/threats and aligns with senior managerial scanning responsibilities (V.A) to identify effective means for new business or reconfiguration.

dwa_titles: Prepare operational progress or status reports.
matched_indicators: Routine documentation/monitoring of progress | Administrative reporting and status review
task_text: Prepare and review operational reports or project progress reports.
justification: Task describes routine preparation and review of status/progress reports (documentation and monitoring). It lacks signals of generating new ideas, championing or implementing new business opportunities, risk-taking, or managerial actions to create new ventures (criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Develop computer or information systems.
matched_indicators: Design and plan strategic computing and information resources | Implement systems for data security, control, and disaster recovery | Direct and identify effective means to create or reconfigure IT resources | Acquire/deploy resources and shepherd IT initiatives
task_text: Develop computer information resources, providing for data security and control, strategic computing, and disaster recovery.
justification: The task entails developing new or improved information resources and strategic computing capabilities, which involves planning (business/IT strategy), implementation (building systems, disaster recovery), and managerial oversight for security and control—matching Planning (II), Execution (III), and Senior/Middle managerial actions (V.A/V.B).

skill_onet_wa: ['Getting Information', 'Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People']
dwa_titles: Evaluate project designs to determine adequacy or feasibility. | Review technical documents to plan work.
matched_indicators: Ratify or approve organizational artifacts (ratify roles/structures) | Direct/authorize implementation through approval
task_text: Review and approve all systems charts and programs prior to their implementation.
justification: This is a routine managerial approval and governance task (oversight of system charts/programs) without signals of opportunity discovery, idea generation, advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of novel products, or risk-taking. It aligns with standard ratification/directing duties rather than entrepreneurial behaviors.

dwa_titles: Manage operations, research, or logistics projects.
task_text: Review project plans to plan and coordinate project activity.
justification: This task describes routine review, planning, and coordination of project activity without signals of opportunity discovery, idea generation, advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of novel products, or eco-innovation. It is standard project management/operational coordination rather than entrepreneurial action.

skill_onet_wa: ['Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People']
dwa_titles: Evaluate employee performance.
matched_indicators: Direct roles | Recognize/ratify roles | Manage and supervise employees
task_text: Assign and review the work of systems analysts, programmers, and other computer-related workers.
justification: This task describes directing and supervising technical staff — a senior/mid-level managerial action (V.A) involving directing roles and managing work that can enable new business activities or innovation by organizing resources and personnel.

skill_onet_wa: ['Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People']
dwa_titles: Analyze data to determine project feasibility.
matched_indicators: Assess project feasibility and requirements (plan/organize) | Convert ideas/proposals into feasible plans | Interpret and shepherd entrepreneurial opportunities | Identify resources and requirements to pursue opportunities
task_text: Evaluate data processing proposals to assess project feasibility and requirements.
justification: Assessing proposals to determine feasibility and requirements aligns with planning/preparation and managerial evaluation of new projects (II) and with middle-manager actions to interpret and shepherd opportunities (V.B). This involves converting ideas into workable plans, deciding resource/requirement needs, and informing go/no-go decisions.

dwa_titles: Manage organizational or project budgets.
task_text: Control operational budget and expenditures.
justification: Controlling budgets/expenditures is a routine financial/administrative managerial duty without explicit signals of opportunity discovery, advocacy, implementation of new initiatives, innovation, or eco-innovation. Metadata indicates a managerial finance context but the task describes maintenance/control rather than launching or championing new business activities.

dwa_titles: Develop software or applications for scientific or technical use.
matched_indicators: Implement new ideas / put effort into pursuing new applications | Lead development and take initiative in building tools | Show innovative and creative behaviors in software design | Take technical risks and use out-of-the-box solutions
task_text: Create or modify web-based bioinformatics tools.
justification: Developing or modifying web-based bioinformatics tools involves implementing new technical solutions and can constitute leading and executing new product/features (III) and requires innovative, creative problem-solving and risk-taking in technical design (IV). In the context of bioinformatics software development, this aligns with implementing new applications and using creative thinking to deliver scientific/technical tools.

dwa_titles: Train personnel in technical or scientific procedures.
task_text: Instruct others in the selection and use of bioinformatics tools.
justification: This task describes training/teaching (routine knowledge transfer and skill development) without signals of opportunity discovery, business planning/advocacy, implementing new business activities, innovation/risk-taking, or eco-innovation. It aligns with routine personnel development rather than entrepreneurial action.

dwa_titles: Research genetic characteristics or expression.
task_text: Compile data for use in activities, such as gene expression profiling, genome annotation, or structural bioinformatics.
justification: This task describes routine data compilation/preparation for downstream analyses (maintenance/administrative support). It lacks signals of opportunity discovery, idea generation, advocacy/planning, implementation of new business activities, risk-taking, managerial actions, or eco-innovation described in criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Analyze biological samples.
task_text: Analyze large molecular datasets, such as raw microarray data, genomic sequence data, or proteomics data, for clinical or basic research purposes.
justification: This task describes routine technical analysis of molecular datasets for research — a core analytic activity without explicit signals of generating or championing new opportunities, planning new business or product launches, leading implementation, taking entrepreneurial risks, managerial role actions, or eco-innovation. It matches routine execution/analysis rather than criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Develop software or applications for scientific or technical use.
matched_indicators: Design new products or recombine resources (convert scientific needs into software) | Develop comprehensive solutions/business-ready applications | Implement new ideas and take initiative to build/deploy applications | Show innovative/creative behaviors and use out-of-the-box technical approaches
task_text: Develop new software applications or customize existing applications to meet specific scientific project needs.
justification: Creating or customizing software to meet scientific project needs involves designing new products/solutions, converting ideas into workable applications, and implementing them—showing opportunity realization, innovation, and active execution consistent with criteria I, II, III, and IV. Context (bioinformatics software development) supports internal product/solution development.

dwa_titles: Develop software or applications for scientific or technical use.
matched_indicators: Generate creative ideas and novel approaches | Design new tools/products for technical use | Implement and develop new analytical solutions | Exhibit innovative, out-of-the-box technical problem solving
task_text: Create novel computational approaches and analytical tools as required by research goals.
justification: Task explicitly requires generating novel approaches and tools (idea generation and product design), implementing analytical solutions for research goals (execution/implementation), and implies innovation and risk-taking typical of R&D in bioinformatics/software development. Matches opportunity discovery, planning/design, implementation, and innovative behavior criteria (I, II, III, IV).

dwa_titles: Develop technical or scientific databases.
task_text: Manipulate publicly accessible, commercial, or proprietary genomic, proteomic, or post-genomic databases.
justification: The task describes technical data manipulation and maintenance of databases without indication of idea generation, opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementing new business activities, risk-taking, managerial initiative, or eco-innovation. It fits routine/executional work rather than intrapreneurial behaviors (I–VI).

dwa_titles: Supervise engineering or other technical personnel.
matched_indicators: Supervise/deploy staff to maximize personnel utilization | Adjust or allocate competencies/processes for operations (first-level managerial action)
task_text: Assign work to staff to obtain maximum utilization of personnel.
justification: This is a routine supervisory/resource-allocation task (assigning and deploying staff to maximize utilization) rather than activity that discovers, plans, champions, or implements new business opportunities or innovations. It aligns with first-level managerial/supervisory duties but lacks signals of opportunity discovery, advocacy, new product/process implementation, or eco-innovation.

dwa_titles: Prepare technical reports for internal use.
task_text: Write technical reports for engineering and management personnel.
justification: Task describes routine documentation for internal audiences (technical reports) without signals of opportunity discovery, advocacy for new ventures, implementation of new products/processes, risk-taking, managerial entrepreneurial actions, or eco-innovation. It aligns with maintenance/administrative reporting rather than criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Interpret design or operational test results.
matched_indicators: Evaluate findings to recognize opportunities and inform design (I: recognize/perceive opportunities, acquire information) | Design or develop new equipment/processes (II: design new products or recombine resources; develop plans) | Test and implement equipment/process changes (III: implement new ideas; act entrepreneurially; lead idea development) | Experiment to surface operational ideas for innovative improvements (V.C: experiment and adjust processes)
task_text: Evaluate findings to develop, design, or test equipment or processes.
justification: Evaluating findings to develop, design, or test equipment or processes involves converting information into new or improved designs and experiments, implementing and testing innovations, and surfacing operational improvements — matching opportunity generation, planning/design, execution, and first-level managerial experimentation criteria.

dwa_titles: Analyze physical, survey, or geographic data.
matched_indicators: Identify opportunity for optimal well placement (recognize opportunities worth pursuing) | Recommend supplementary processes (convert ideas into feasible plans / design new processes) | Make implementation-focused recommendations and inform operational decisions (lead exploitation / take initiative)
task_text: Analyze data to recommend placement of wells and supplementary processes to enhance production.
justification: The task involves identifying opportunities (optimal well placement), generating recommendations for new/changed processes to enhance production (planning/advocacy), and drives implementation-focused decisions—matching opportunity discovery (I), planning/preparation (II), and execution/implementation behaviors (III) in an engineering context.

dwa_titles: Maintain operational records or records systems.
task_text: Maintain records of drilling and production operations.
justification: The task describes routine documentation and record-keeping (maintenance of operational records), which is administrative and service-oriented rather than discovery, planning, advocacy, implementation of new opportunities, innovation, or managerial actions described in criteria I–VI.

skill_onet_wa: ['Monitoring Processes, Materials, or Surroundings', 'Developing Objectives and Strategies']
dwa_titles: Develop technical methods or processes. | Monitor the productivity or efficiency of industrial operations.
matched_indicators: Adjust processes through competence modification | Experiment to surface operational ideas for innovative improvements | Put effort into pursuing new business/operational improvements
task_text: Monitor production rates, and plan rework processes to improve production.
justification: The task goes beyond routine monitoring by explicitly planning process rework to improve production, which aligns with role-specific first-level managerial actions to adjust and experiment with processes (V.C) and with execution/implementation behaviors to pursue operational improvements (III). Context (petroleum engineering, monitoring and developing methods) supports operational innovation rather than purely administrative work.

skill_onet_wa: ['Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others']
dwa_titles: Explain engineering drawings, specifications, or other technical information.
task_text: Interpret drilling and testing information for personnel.
justification: The task describes routine interpretation and communication of technical drilling/testing information to personnel—an explanatory/training or informational activity rather than opportunity discovery, planning, implementation of new business activities, or eco-innovation. It lacks signals of idea generation, advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of new products/processes, risk-taking, or managerial actions aimed at creating new ventures.

dwa_titles: Develop healthcare quality and safety procedures.
matched_indicators: Anticipate problems and opportunities / recognize areas of high risk | Experiment to surface operational ideas for innovative improvements / adjust processes
task_text: Participate in quality improvement activities including discussions of areas where risk of error is high.
justification: Participating in QI discussions involves identifying opportunities and anticipating problems (I) and aligns with first-level managerial actions to experiment and adjust processes for improvement (V.C). This is proactive, problem-focused behavior beyond routine execution.

skill_onet_wa: ['Analyzing Data or Information', 'Controlling Machines and Processes']
dwa_titles: Analyze test data or images to inform diagnosis or treatment. | Operate diagnostic imaging equipment.
task_text: Perform or interpret the outcomes of diagnostic imaging procedures including magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), computer tomography (CT), positron emission tomography (PET), nuclear cardiology treadmill studies, mammography, or ultrasound.
justification: This task describes routine clinical performance and interpretation of diagnostic imaging—a professional, operational activity focused on service delivery and analysis without signals of opportunity discovery, innovation, planning/advocacy, implementation of new business activities, risk-taking, or eco-innovation required by criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Maintain medical or professional knowledge.
task_text: Participate in continuing education activities to maintain and develop expertise.
justification: This task describes routine professional development and knowledge maintenance for a radiologist (maintenance of professional knowledge). It lacks signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementation of new business activities, innovation/risk-taking, managerial actions to create new ventures, or explicit eco-innovation (criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Prepare reports summarizing patient diagnostic or care activities.
task_text: Prepare comprehensive interpretive reports of findings.
justification: Task describes routine documentation and diagnostic reporting typical of radiology practice (administrative/clinical recording) without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementing new business activities, innovation, or eco-innovation. Metadata (radiologist/report summarization) supports a maintenance/recording interpretation rather than intrapreneurial action.

dwa_titles: Record patient medical histories.
task_text: Document the performance, interpretation, or outcomes of all procedures performed.
justification: This task describes routine documentation/recording of procedures and outcomes, which is administrative and maintenance-oriented without signals of idea generation, planning/advocacy, implementation of new opportunities, risk-taking, managerial entrepreneurial actions, or eco-innovation (does not meet any of criteria I–VI). The occupation context (radiologists; documenting medical histories) reinforces this as standard recordkeeping.

dwa_titles: Develop healthcare quality and safety procedures.
matched_indicators: Design new processes / develop procedures (plan and organize) | Implement and monitor new or improved practices (put effort into pursuing improvements) | Adjust processes through competence modification / experiment to surface operational ideas
task_text: Develop or monitor procedures to ensure adequate quality control of images.
justification: Developing or monitoring QC procedures involves planning and organizing new or improved processes and implementing/adjusting operational practices—matching Planning/Preparation (II), Execution/Implementation (III), and First-Level Managerial Actions (V.C). In the radiology quality/safety context this is process design and oversight rather than purely routine service.

dwa_titles: Analyze test data or images to inform diagnosis or treatment. | Send information, materials or documentation.
task_text: Review or transmit images and information using picture archiving or communications systems.
justification: This task describes routine review and transmission of images/information using PACS/communication systems—administrative/clinical workflow activity without signals of opportunity discovery, planning, advocacy, implementation of new initiatives, innovation, or managerial actions described in I–VI.

dwa_titles: Document organizational or operational procedures.
task_text: Document testing procedures, methodologies, or criteria.
justification: This task describes routine documentation of procedures (administrative/maintenance) without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of new business activities, innovation/risk-taking, managerial entrepreneurial actions, or eco-innovation.

dwa_titles: Prepare operational progress or status reports.
matched_indicators: Routine reporting of nonconformance and daily production quality | Preparation of operational progress/status reports and documentation | Regular root-cause analysis as maintenance/problem resolution rather than opportunity creation
task_text: Produce reports regarding nonconformance of products or processes, daily production quality, root cause analyses, or quality trends.
justification: The task describes routine monitoring and reporting (daily quality, nonconformance reports, trend tracking) and regular root-cause analyses for maintenance and control rather than discovery, advocacy, or implementation of new business opportunities. This aligns with administrative/documentation and operational problem-solving rather than criteria I–VI for intrapreneurship.

skill_onet_wa: ['Making Decisions and Solving Problems', 'Developing Objectives and Strategies']
dwa_titles: Develop operating strategies, plans, or procedures. | Implement organizational process or policy changes.
matched_indicators: Design new procedures / convert ideas into feasible plans | Implement new ideas and put effort into pursuing process changes | Adjust processes through competence modification / experiment to surface operational improvements
task_text: Create and implement inspection and testing criteria or procedures.
justification: The task requires designing (planning) new procedures and putting them into practice, which matches planning/preparation and execution behaviors; it also aligns with first-level managerial process adjustment actions in a quality-control managerial role.

skill_onet_wa: ['Analyzing Data or Information', 'Communicating with Supervisors, Peers, or Subordinates']
dwa_titles: Analyze data to inform operational decisions or activities. | Confer with organizational members to accomplish work activities.
task_text: Analyze quality control test results and provide feedback and interpretation to production management or staff.
justification: This task describes routine analysis and communication of QC results—operational monitoring and feedback without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of new products/processes, innovation/risk-taking, or explicit managerial actions to develop new business or eco-innovation (does not meet criteria I–VI). The metadata (quality control manager role; data analysis and communication) supports an interpretation as routine operational quality control rather than intrapreneurial activity.

dwa_titles: Document organizational or operational procedures.
task_text: Review and update standard operating procedures or quality assurance manuals.
justification: This task describes routine documentation and maintenance of procedures (updating SOPs/QA manuals) without explicit signals of opportunity discovery, business planning, advocacy, implementation of new ventures, or eco-innovation. Context (Quality Control Systems Managers; documenting procedures) reinforces a procedural/administrative role rather than entrepreneurial initiative.

dwa_titles: Monitor organizational procedures to ensure proper functioning.
task_text: Monitor performance of quality control systems to ensure effectiveness and efficiency.
justification: This task describes routine monitoring and maintenance of existing quality control systems (service/operational oversight) without mention of idea generation, planning new initiatives, implementation of new ventures, risk-taking, or eco-innovation. It aligns with regular process monitoring rather than criteria I–VI for intrapreneurial behaviors.

skill_onet_wa: ['Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others']
dwa_titles: Communicate organizational information to customers or other stakeholders. | Communicate organizational policies and procedures.
task_text: Communicate quality control information to all relevant organizational departments, outside vendors, or contractors.
justification: This task describes routine dissemination of quality control information (administrative/communication service) without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of new business activities, risk-taking, or eco-innovation. It aligns with maintenance/operational communication rather than criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Direct organizational operations, projects, or services.
task_text: Direct the tracking of defects, test results, or other regularly reported quality control data.
justification: This is routine oversight of regularly reported QC data (monitoring and directing data tracking) rather than generating or implementing new opportunities, advocating new initiatives, or taking innovative/risky actions. It aligns with operational maintenance and reporting rather than criteria I–VI for intrapreneurship.

skill_onet_wa: ['Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards']
dwa_titles: Review documents or materials for compliance with policies or regulations.
task_text: Review quality documentation necessary for regulatory submissions and inspections.
justification: The task describes routine review of documentation for regulatory compliance and inspections, which is a maintenance/administrative activity without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementation of new business activities, innovation, or eco-innovation (does not meet criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Manage budgets for appropriate resource allocation.
matched_indicators: Manage and allocate resources (prepare/approve budgets) | Monitor and adjust operational finances
task_text: Approve, prepare, monitor, and adjust operational budgets.
justification: This is routine resource allocation and financial oversight without signals of opportunity discovery, idea generation, advocacy for new ventures, implementation of new products/processes, innovation, or eco-innovation. While it maps to role-specific managerial budget actions (V.B), the task description lacks entrepreneurial intent (planning new business, championing change, implementing innovation), so it is not intrapreneurial.

dwa_titles: Apply information technology to solve business or other applied problems.
matched_indicators: Generate creative ideas and adapt principles to new uses | Implement new ideas and apply technology to solve applied problems | Show innovative behavior and apply novel approaches (risk-taking/creativity)
task_text: Apply theoretical expertise and innovation to create or apply new technology, such as adapting principles for applying computers to new uses.
justification: The task explicitly involves generating and applying new technological ideas and innovation (Opportunity Discovery I, Innovative/Risk-Taking IV) and implementing new technology solutions (Execution III). As a computer and information research scientist role, it aligns with internal development of new applications and technical innovation.

dwa_titles: Assign duties or work schedules to employees.
matched_indicators: Routine task assignment/scheduling | Operational prioritization without innovation or opportunity pursuit
task_text: Assign or schedule tasks to meet work priorities and goals.
justification: This is a routine administrative/managerial scheduling duty focused on operational task assignment without signals of opportunity discovery, innovation, advocacy for new initiatives, implementation of new ventures, or risk-taking (does not meet criteria I–IV or VI). While it is a managerial action, it lacks evidence of entrepreneurial scope or advancing new business activities.

skill_onet_wa: ['Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People']
dwa_titles: Evaluate project designs to determine adequacy or feasibility.
matched_indicators: Anticipate problems and opportunities / assess feasibility issues | Plan by evaluating and preparing projects (informing resource deployment and project selection)
task_text: Evaluate project plans and proposals to assess feasibility issues.
justification: Assessing feasibility of project plans entails anticipating problems and threats and judging whether opportunities are viable, aligning with opportunity discovery/assessment and planning/preparation behaviors (I and II). As a research-scientist context, this evaluation can inform resource allocation and project selection, supporting intrapreneurial decision-making.

dwa_titles: Analyze data to identify or resolve operational problems.
matched_indicators: Identify and analyze problems to find new opportunities/solutions | Develop and implement technical solutions (lead idea development and execution) | Apply innovative/creative approaches and risk-taking in solution design | Experiment and adjust processes/solutions to surface improvements
task_text: Analyze problems to develop solutions involving computer hardware and software.
justification: The task requires problem analysis and developing solutions (matches opportunity discovery/idea generation and execution). In a research scientist role it implies designing new technical solutions, experimenting, and implementing innovations rather than routine maintenance, aligning with criteria I (identify opportunities/ideas), III (implement new ideas/lead solution development), IV (innovative behaviors), and V.C (experiment/adjust processes).

dwa_titles: Design integrated computer systems.
matched_indicators: Generate creative ideas / new product ideas | Design new products and recombine resources (system design) | Implement new ideas and lead development of new systems | Show innovative, out-of-the-box technical solutions and risk-taking
task_text: Design computers and the software that runs them.
justification: Designing computers and their software involves creating new products/systems, generating technical solutions, planning and implementing integrated systems, and requires innovative, creative engineering—matching opportunity discovery, planning/design, execution, and risk-taking criteria (I–IV). The occupation context (research/design of integrated systems) supports intrapreneurial behavior.

dwa_titles: Maintain operational records or records systems.
task_text: Maintain records of performance reports for future reference.
justification: The task describes routine maintenance/administrative record-keeping without signaling idea generation, opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementation of new initiatives, risk-taking, managerial actions to create new business, or eco-innovation.

dwa_titles: Design systems to reduce harmful emissions.
matched_indicators: Generate creative ideas and search for new techniques/technologies | Design new products or recombine resources; develop plans to implement changes | Implement new designs and lead technical modifications | Show innovative behavior and take technical risks to achieve emissions reductions | Reduce emissions during the production/process or end-use (eco-innovation)
task_text: Design new or modify existing aerospace systems to reduce polluting emissions, such as nitrogen oxide, carbon monoxide, or smoke emissions.
justification: The task involves designing or modifying systems to reduce emissions — an eco-innovation activity that requires creative idea generation, technical design/planning, and implementation actions within an organization. It matches opportunity discovery and idea generation (I), planning/design and advocacy (II), execution/implementation (III), innovative/risk-taking behaviors (IV), and explicitly eco-innovation (VI) in an aerospace engineering context.

dwa_titles: Prepare procedural documents.
task_text: Write technical reports or other documentation, such as handbooks or bulletins, for use by engineering staff, management, or customers.
justification: The task describes routine documentation and information recording without signals of opportunity discovery, planning/advocacy, implementation of new ventures, innovation/risk-taking, managerial entrepreneurial actions, or eco-innovation. It aligns with maintenance/administrative work rather than criteria I–VI.

dwa_titles: Determine design criteria or specifications.
matched_indicators: Design new products or recombine resources (develop design criteria/specifications) | Plan by developing comprehensive plans (testing methods, costs, schedules) | Implement and manage new product requirements (quality standards, completion dates) | Address environmental standards and reduce environmental impact
task_text: Develop design criteria for aeronautical or aerospace products or systems, including testing methods, production costs, quality standards, environmental standards, or completion dates.
justification: Task involves designing new product/system criteria, planning tests, setting quality, cost, schedule and environmental standards — matching Planning/Preparation (II) and Execution/Implementation (III) behaviors; environmental standards also map to Eco-Innovation (VI). It requires converting ideas into feasible specifications, organizing implementation, and addressing environmental impacts.

dwa_titles: Create models of engineering designs or methods.
matched_indicators: Generate creative ideas and new techniques (develop models/methods) | Implement new ideas and lead development/evaluation of designs | Show innovative, out-of-the-box technical behavior and take risks in methods
task_text: Formulate mathematical models or other methods of computer analysis to develop, evaluate, or modify design, according to customer engineering requirements.
justification: The task involves creating novel analytical methods and models to develop or modify designs, which aligns with opportunity discovery and idea generation (I), execution/implementation of new solutions (III), and innovative/risk-taking behavior (IV). As an aerospace engineering design task, it requires creative problem-solving and introduction of new technical approaches to meet customer requirements.

dwa_titles: Create databases to store electronic data. | Update computer database information.
matched_indicators: Routine modification/maintenance of systems | Directing programmers/analysts (operational supervision)
task_text: Modify existing databases and database management systems or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
justification: The task describes routine modification/maintenance of databases and directing staff to implement changes—administrative/operational actions without signals of opportunity discovery, planning for new business, innovation, or risk-taking (no idea generation, advocacy, new product launch, or eco-innovation).

dwa_titles: Read documents to gather technical information.
task_text: Review workflow charts developed by programmer analyst to understand tasks computer will perform, such as updating records.
justification: This task is routine documentation review to understand existing processes (maintenance/knowledge transfer) with no signals of idea generation, planning/advocacy, implementation of new business activities, risk-taking, managerial entrepreneurial actions, or eco-innovation.

dwa_titles: Develop computer or information security policies or procedures. | Implement security measures for computer or information systems.
task_text: Plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard information in computer files against accidental or unauthorized damage, modification or disclosure.
justification: The task describes routine planning, coordination, and implementation of security controls — operational/maintenance activities typical for a database administrator. It lacks signals of opportunity discovery, innovation, advocacy for new business initiatives, risk-taking for new ventures, or eco-innovation (criteria I–VI).

dwa_titles: Develop database parameters or specifications. | Write computer programming code.
matched_indicators: Design new products or recombine resources → develop logical/physical DB designs | Plan and organize / convert ideas into feasible plans → specify identifiers to DBMS | Take charge and direct others / recruit/supervise → direct others in coding descriptions
task_text: Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system, or direct others in coding descriptions.
justification: The task involves designing logical and physical database descriptions (planning/design) and coding or directing others (execution and first-level managerial action). This matches planning/preparation (II) and execution/management behaviors (III), plus role-specific first-level managerial actions (V.C).

skill_onet_wa: ['Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People', 'Thinking Creatively']

dwa_titles: Implement security measures for computer or information systems.
matched_indicators: Configure user permissions (routine administrative security) | Assign access levels to database segments (standard operational task)
task_text: Specify users and user access levels for each segment of database.
justification: This is a routine administrative/security task about configuring user permissions for database segments. dwa_titles: Monitor green energy equipment, systems, or facilities.
matched_indicators: Routine execution/maintenance and corrective actions — no opportunity discovery or innovation

It aligns with operational upkeep rather than intrapreneurial behaviors (I–VI).

dwa_titles: Evaluate energy production data.

dwa_titles: Analyze data to determine project feasibility.

justification: Analyzing cost, materials, and efficiency for biofuels is feasibility-focused work that discovers opportunities and informs planning for new or improved production activities (matches I and II) and directly relates to eco-innovation in biofuels (VI). This aligns with opportunity identification, planning/preparation for ventures, and environmental improvement.

dwa_titles: Operate green energy production equipment.
task_text: Adjust temperature, pressure, vacuum, level, flow rate, or transfer of biofuels to maintain processes at required levels.

The metadata (biofuels production manager; operating green energy equipment) confirms an operational, control-focused context.

dwa_titles: Prepare operational budgets for green energy or other green operations.

task_text: Prepare and manage biofuels plant or unit budgets.
justification: Budget preparation and management for a biofuels unit involves planning and allocating resources (planning/advocacy and resource deployment) and is a role-specific managerial action in a green/eco-innovation domain, supporting new or sustained green operations.

justification: Approving proposals for new/changed production processes and equipment involves managerial decision-making to implement innovations, allocate resources, and direct operations (matches Execution/Implementation and Senior-level managerial actions). In the biofuels context this can enable eco-innovation (process changes that improve green energy production).

The producer/director role metadata supports an internal creative/product-development context.

dwa_titles: Create models of engineering designs or methods. | Test performance of electrical, electronic, mechanical, or integrated systems or equipment.
matched_indicators: Generate and test alternative design ideas (idea generation, experimental search) | Implement experiments to assess feasibility and operating condition effects (execution/implementation) | Experiment to surface operational ideas and modify processes (first-level managerial experimentation) | Assess sustainability and potential environmental benefits (eco-innovation)
task_text: Develop or test models of alternate designs or processing methods to assess feasibility, sustainability, operating condition effects, potential new applications, or necessity of modification.
justification: The task involves generating and testing alternative designs (opportunity discovery and idea generation, I), implementing experiments and evaluating feasibility and new applications (execution/implementation, III), and explicitly assesses sustainability (eco-innovation, VI). It also involves experimental activities typical of first-level managerial/operational innovation (V.C).

dwa_titles: Design video game features or details.

justification: Balancing and adjusting gameplay to secure critical and commercial success requires discovering and implementing product improvements, iterating designs, and taking initiative to improve market fit—matching opportunity discovery/idea generation (I), planning/advocacy and design (II), execution/implementation (III), and innovative/risk-taking behaviors (IV) in a game-design context.

As a video game designer role focused on 'Thinking Creatively' and feature design, this task advances new product/content opportunities rather than routine maintenance.
